citations.narrative:
There were no disposition records available for 1 hedgehog, 1 cockatiel, 1 parakeet, and 2 red-rumped parrots that have
left the facility since the previous inspection. Additionally, there were no acquisition records available for 2 cockatiels that
were present at the time of the inspection. Although the licensee purports that these animals are or were present for
boarding, they are still regulated animals under the provisions of the Animal Welfare Act (AWA). Failure to maintain
adequate records of acquisition and disposition prevents APHIS officials from verifying that the movement of animals is
compliant with the AWA. The facility must make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the name
and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired or to whom the animals were disposed, USDA license
number (if applicable) or driver's license number, the date of acquisition or disposal, the species, and the numbers of the
animals.

At the time of the inspection, there was a bag of pellets used to feed chinchillas that was open and stored on the floor of
the facility. Although there was no evidence of contamination, storing food in this manner does not adequately protect it
from spoilage, molding, or vermin. The facility must ensure that it stores food in a manner that provides sufficient
protection from deterioration, molding, and contamination by vermin. This was corrected at the time of the inspection. To
remain corrected after September 23, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There were no disposition records available for 1 hedgehog, 1 cockatiel, 1 parakeet, and 2 red-rumped parrots that have 
left the facility since the previous inspection. Additionally, there were no acquisition records available for 2 cockatiels that 
were present at the time of the inspection. Although the licensee purports that these animals are or were present for 
boarding, they are still regulated animals under the provisions of the Animal Welfare Act (AWA). Failure to maintain 
adequate records of acquisition and disposition prevents APHIS officials from verifying that the movement of animals is 
compliant with the AWA. The facility must make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the name 
and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired or to whom the animals were disposed, USDA license 
number (if applicable) or driver's license number, the date of acquisition or disposal, the species, and the numbers of the 
animals. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
At the time of the inspection, there was a bag of pellets used to feed chinchillas that was open and stored on the floor of 
the facility. Although there was no evidence of contamination, storing food in this manner does not adequately protect it 
from spoilage, molding, or vermin. The facility must ensure that it stores food in a manner that provides sufficient 
protection from deterioration, molding, and contamination by vermin. This was corrected at the time of the inspection. To 
remain corrected after September 23, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
